meanings.definition: The light-sensitive layer of tissue at the back of the eye.
meanings.sent1: Her retinas captured the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her retinas during the eye check-up.
meanings.sent3: The retinas in his eyes were like tiny cameras recording everything.
meanings.sent4: As the artist painted, her retinas absorbed the vibrant colors around her.
meanings.sent5: The retinas acted like a canvas, translating light into images for the brain.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the retinas of various animals.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, they analyzed the retinas under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The retinas on the slides seemed to form a pattern when viewed together.
meanings.sent4: The retinas of the insects glistened under the bright lights.
meanings.sent5: Examining the retinas closely revealed intricate details about each creature.
